CTabControl

A tab container control.  The controls added to a tab panel can be accessed through this object.

This control extends CControl.  All basic properties and functions are implemented and documented in this class.

Summary
CTabControlA tab container control.
Properties
TabsA list of all tabs.
TextThe text of the first tab.
SelectedItemThe selected tab item.
SelectedIndexThe index of the selected tab item.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
Click(TabItem)Invoked when the user clicked on the control.
DoubleClick(TabItem)Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.
RightClick(TabItem)Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.
DoubleRightClick(TabItem)Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.
CTabControl.CTabsAn array of tabs.
Properties
1,2,3,4,...Individual tabs can be accessed by their index.
Functions
MaxIndexReturns the number of tabs.
AddAdds a tab.
CTabControl.CTabs.CTabA single tab object.
Functions and Properties
AddControlAdds a control to this tab.
TextThe text of the tab.
IconThe filename of the icon associated with this tab.
IconNumberThe index of the icon in a multi-icon file.
SetIconSets the icon of a tab.

Properties

Tabs

A list of all tabs.  Each tab contains a list of controls that belong to it.  The returned object is of type CTabControl.CTabs

Text

The text of the first tab.

SelectedItem

The selected tab item.

SelectedIndex

The index of the selected tab item.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

Click(TabItem)

Invoked when the user clicked on the control.

DoubleClick(TabItem)

Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.

RightClick(TabItem)

Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.

DoubleRightClick(TabItem)

Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.

CTabControl.CTabs

An array of tabs.

Summary
Properties
1,2,3,4,...Individual tabs can be accessed by their index.
Functions
MaxIndexReturns the number of tabs.
AddAdds a tab.

Properties

1,2,3,4,...

Individual tabs can be accessed by their index.

Functions

MaxIndex

Returns the number of tabs.

Add

Adds a tab.

Parameters

TextThe text of the new tab.  If this parameter contains a pipe character (|), multiple tabs will be created and the return value is an array of CTab objects.

Returns

An object of type CTabControl.CTabs.CTab.  If multiple tabs are created, an array of CTab objects is returned.

CTabControl.CTabs.CTab

A single tab object.

Summary
Functions and Properties
AddControlAdds a control to this tab.
TextThe text of the tab.
IconThe filename of the icon associated with this tab.
IconNumberThe index of the icon in a multi-icon file.
SetIconSets the icon of a tab.

Functions and Properties

AddControl

Adds a control to this tab.  The parameters correspond to the Add() function of CGUI.

Parameters

TypeThe type of the control.
NameThe name of the control.
OptionsOptions used for creating the control.
TextThe text of the control.

Text

The text of the tab.

Icon

The filename of the icon associated with this tab.

IconNumber

The index of the icon in a multi-icon file.

SetIcon

Sets the icon of a tab.

Parameters

FilenameThe filename of the file containing the icon.
IconNumberThe icon number in a multi-icon file.
Basic control class from which all controls extend.
An array of tabs.
Attention! 
A single tab object.
